text:
It's very clear from the rules of a To Score market:

> Each player constitutes a separate and independent market and commission is charged accordingly.

elements.text: It's very clear from the rules of a To Score market:
Each player constitutes a separate and independent market and commission is charged accordingly.

text: <@UBS7QANF3> Sort of agreed, but you need to have a reasonable amount of knowledge and experience to be able to infer clearly what that means. It also feels like that's a technical limitation in how they're managing the markets, rather than an intent.

elements.text: Sort of agreed, but you need to have a reasonable amount of knowledge and experience to be able to infer clearly what that means. It also feels like that's a technical limitation in how they're managing the markets, rather than an intent.

text: Isn't it like that because there's no way of knowing how many winners there are going to be? Technically everyone could score.

elements.text: Isn't it like that because there's no way of knowing how many winners there are going to be? Technically everyone could score.

text: I'm not convinced by the technical argument. I believe it's because there can be any number of winners

elements.text: I'm not convinced by the technical argument. I believe it's because there can be any number of winners

text: Isn't that technically the case for racing too? They can already handle dead heats without the need to make each horse or dog a separate market.

elements.text: Isn't that technically the case for racing too? They can already handle dead heats without the need to make each horse or dog a separate market.

text: Dead heats are pretty rare though and the rules are clear whereas more than one person scoring in a game of football is not.

elements.text: Dead heats are pretty rare though and the rules are clear whereas more than one person scoring in a game of football is not.

text: It’s probably not clear in a vacuum but it fits with what <@U01J98RDHRN> has been charged

elements.text: It’s probably not clear in a vacuum but it fits with what
has been charged

text: I don't play horse place markets but does this sort of thing happen there too?

elements.text: I don't play horse place markets but does this sort of thing happen there too?

text: Seems pretty harsh to be slammed for double your net winnings on the market.

elements.text: Seems pretty harsh to be slammed for double your net winnings on the market.

text: It certainly happens at the dogs and can get a smidgen complicated when the deadheat is in second place, but they simply half profits and losses and apply them to both dogs and then charge commission at the market level.

elements.text: It certainly happens at the dogs and can get a smidgen complicated when the deadheat is in second place, but they simply half profits and losses and apply them to both dogs and then charge commission at the market level.

text: I think there’s an important lesson here to make sure that you understand the rules of the bets you are placing. Dead heats are another “gotcha” and I’ve personally ended up with inflated backtest results by not taking them into account when simulating profit. Retirement rules in tennis are another example I’m aware of

elements.text: I think there’s an important lesson here to make sure that you understand the rules of the bets you are placing. Dead heats are another “gotcha” and I’ve personally ended up with inflated backtest results by not taking them into account when simulating profit. Retirement rules in tennis are another example I’m aware of

text: Yeah but the market has one winner so DH is clear - even if there were more than 2. This scorer market though seems really harsh but I suppose each player scoring is independent of any other. I don't dabble in these markets but I can understand why someone might be pissed off about the outcome.

elements.text: Yeah but the market has one winner so DH is clear - even if there were more than 2. This scorer market though seems really harsh but I suppose each player scoring is independent of any other. I don't dabble in these markets but I can understand why someone might be pissed off about the outcome.

text: Yeah - tie in a cricket match is another that can catch people out although in test matches they are incredibly rare and I believe the rules treat a test match tie the same as the draw result (not 100% on that though).

elements.text: Yeah - tie in a cricket match is another that can catch people out although in test matches they are incredibly rare and I believe the rules treat a test match tie the same as the draw result (not 100% on that though).

text: I appreciate that the rules are not defined as you expected them to be. But this is no different to if they literally had a separate market for each player. As <@UUE6E1LA1> says, the probability of each player scoring is (more or less) independent so why should they be lumped together?

elements.text: I appreciate that the rules are not defined as you expected them to be. But this is no different to if they literally had a separate market for each player. As
says, the probability of each player scoring is (more or less) independent so why should they be lumped together?

text:
"*When do I pay Commission?*
Betfair charges Commission only on your net winnings on a market. You do not pay commission on losing bets."

elements.text: When do I pay Commission?
Betfair charges Commission only on your net winnings on a market. You do not pay commission on losing bets."

text: I dunno it says on a market, not on a "independent event." You know what I mean? And I'd argue that the probabilities aren't exactly independent, they're in a weird spot, but I digress.

elements.text: I dunno it says on a market, not on a "independent event." You know what I mean? And I'd argue that the probabilities aren't exactly independent, they're in a weird spot, but I digress.

text: I agree that they've set themselves up to annoy customers by the general rule being that commission is net winnings on a market and then having this weird single To-Score market for each match which is actually a bunch of separate markets all under the same market ID

elements.text: I agree that they've set themselves up to annoy customers by the general rule being that commission is net winnings on a market and then having this weird single To-Score market for each match which is actually a bunch of separate markets all under the same market ID

>  And i should probably just focus more on the other markets.

text: aye, I will certainly continue, don't get me wrong :slightly_smiling_face:. But appreciate the points, makes me feel less crazy for doing it. I more just meant relative to the other markets I've been messing with, I may focus slightly more in the other places with the much more generous fee structures. Obvious refinements to me seem to be yeah closing out more positions when possible, and perhaps requiring more edge to jump into a runner. Any other thoughts on implications of the structure or things I should think about?
